maml:description.maml:para: Export a WSB configuration to an XML file.
This command will take an existing Windows Sandbox Configuration object and export it to an XML file.
Specify a wsbConfiguration object.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Don't overwrite an existing file.
Specify the path and filename. It must end in .wsb
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specify a wsbConfiguration object.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Don't overwrite an existing file.
Specify the path and filename. It must end in .wsb
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-WsbConfiguration -Name demo -LogonCommand C:\scripts\wsbscripts\sandbox-basic.cmd -MemoryInMB (4096*2) -MappedFolder (New-WsbMappedFolder -HostFolder c:\scratch -SandboxFolder c:\junk) -Description "My test WSB configuration" | Export-WsbConfiguration -Path c:\scratch\scratch.wsb

maml:description.maml:para: Get a Windows Sandbox configuration.
This command will give you information about a sandbox configuration.
Specify the path to the .wsb file. The command will autocomplete to the $wsbConfigPath variable.
Only display metadata information.
Only display metadata information.
Specify the path to the .wsb file. The command will autocomplete to the $wsbConfigPath variable.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-WsbConfiguration C:\Scripts\WindowsSandboxTools\wsbConfig\dev.wsb
Name: C:\scripts\wsbconfig\dev.wsb
vGPU : Enable MemoryInMB : 8192 AudioInput : Disable VideoInput : Default ClipboardRedirection : Default PrinterRedirection : Default Networking : Default ProtectedClient : Disable LogonCommand : C:\scripts\wsbScripts\sandbox-setup.cmd MappedFolders : C:\scripts -> C:\scripts [RO:False] C:\Pluralsight -> C:\Pluralsight [RO:True]

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-WsbConfiguration C:\Scripts\WindowsSandboxTools\wsbConfig\dev.wsb -MetadataOnly
Author Name Description Updated ------ ---- ----------- ------- Jeff C:\scripts\wsbconfig\dev.wsb A test wsb file 12/10/2020 8:50:03 AM

maml:description.maml:para: Create a new Windows Sandbox configuration.
This command will create a new Wsbconfiguration object. Use Export-Wsbconfiguration to save it to disk.
Who is the author?
Provide a description for this configuration.
The path and file are relative to the Windows Sandbox configuration.
Specify a mapped folder object.
Give the configuration a name
The path and file are relative to the Windows Sandbox configuration.
Specify a mapped folder object.
A set of metadata values. This will typically be configured by default.
Who is the author?
Provide a description for this configuration.
The path and file are relative to the Windows Sandbox configuration.
Specify a mapped folder object.
A set of metadata values. This will typically be configured by default.
Give the configuration a name

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $new = New-WsbConfiguration -Name demo -LogonCommand C:\scripts\wsbscripts\sandbox-basic.cmd -MemoryInMB (4096*2) -MappedFolder (New-WsbMappedFolder -HostFolder c:\scratch -SandboxFolder c:\junk) -description "My scratch configuration"

maml:description.maml:para: Create a mapped folder object.
You this folder to create a new mapped folder object. You can use this when creating a new Windows sandbox configuration. The sandbox will only have a C: drive.
Specify the path to the local folder you want to map. This folder must already exist.
Specify the mapped folder for the Windows Sandbox. It must start with C:\
Specify if you want the mapping to be Read-Only.
Specify the path to the local folder you want to map. This folder must already exist.
Specify if you want the mapping to be Read-Only.
Specify the mapped folder for the Windows Sandbox. It must start with C:\

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $map = New-WsbMappedFolder -HostFolder c:\work -SandboxFolder c:\work PS C:\> New-WsbConfiguration -Name work -MappedFolder $map -Description "Work sandbox"

dev:remarks.maml:para: Create a shared folder with write access and then use that object in a new configuration.

maml:description.maml:para: Start a Windows sandbox configuration.
Use this command, or its alias wsb, to launch Windows Sandbox. You can specify a configuration or use -NoSetup to run the default sandbox.
Specify the path to a wsb file. The command will autocomplete using the $wsbConfigPath variable.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specify desktop resolutions as an array like 1280,720. The default is 1920,1080. This feature may not be 100% correct and should be considered an experimental feature.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Start with no customizations.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specify desktop resolutions as an array like 1280,720. The default is 1920,1080. This feature may not be 100% correct and should be considered an experimental feature.
Specify the path to a wsb file. The command will autocomplete using the $wsbConfigPath variable.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Start with no customizations.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specify desktop resolutions as an array like 1280,720. The default is 1920,1080. This feature may not be 100% correct and should be considered an experimental feature.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This will launch the default Windows sandobx and attempt to configure the screen resolution to 1024x768.
